subject: RE: [junit] assertNotEquals, another solution
msgSnippet: I m having a hard time seeing why this would be superior to Brian s much simpler implementation! I would revise Brian s method slightly though: static public
messageBody:
I'm having a hard time seeing why this would be superior to Brian's much simpler implementation!
 
I would revise Brian's method slightly though:
 
    static public void assertNotEquals(String message, Object shouldNotBe, Object actual) {
        if (shouldNotBe == null) {
            assertNotNull(message, actual);
        } else if (shouldNotBe.equals(actual)) {
            failEquals(message, shouldNotBe);
        }
    }
    static public void assertNotEquals(Object shouldNotBe, Object actual) {
        assertNotEquals(null, shouldNotBe, actual);
    }
    static private void failEquals(String message, Object shouldNotBe) {
        String formatted= "";
        if (message != null)
            formatted= message+" ";
        fail(formatted+"expected not to be:<"+shouldNotBe+">");
    }
Kevin
-----Original Message-----
From: mrettig@... [mailto:mrettig@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 20, 2001 9:08 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] assertNotEquals


Brian Robinson wrote:
>Has anyone written an assertNotEquals method?

This method simply uses the standard method assertEquals method. This way you can reuse the overloaded assertEquals method.

How about:
public void assertNotEquals(Object shouldNotBe, Object actual){
               assertNotEquals(null, shouldNotBe, actual);
  }

public void assertNotEquals(String msg, Object shouldNotBe, Object actual){
        String formatted= "";
        if (message != null)
                formatted= message+" ";

        boolean isEqual = false;
        try{
                assertEquals(shouldNotBe, actual);
                isEqual = true;
        {
        catch(Throwable valuesNotEqual){
                isEqual = false;
        }
        if(!isEqual)
                fail(formatted+"expected:<"+shouldNotBe+"> equaled:<"+actual+">");
}
